content.raw: This is a follow up to pull request #1487. Mouse movement should not affect rendering framerate too much now.
content.html: This is a follow up to pull request #1487. Mouse movement should not affect rendering framerate too much now.

content.raw: It looks much better, though I haven't tested with the FPS display.
content.html: It looks much better, though I haven't tested with the FPS display.

content.raw: [jenkins looks ok](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/585/) (though it doesn't do the main window test)
content.html: jenkins looks ok (though it doesn't do the main window test)

content.raw: I vote to just make an issue for this qtest shenanigans.
content.html: I vote to just make an issue for this qtest shenanigans.
Let's use #1261

content.raw:
FPS looks improved but still choppy when I send lots of mouse events. Some preliminary printouts reveal that the average FPS under lots of mouse events is about 25.8. Before this PR, I was seeing an average FPS of about 12.5 under these conditions.

`MainWindow` tests all pass with no crashes on my machine. Steve, did you install your workspace before running the test?
content.html:
FPS looks improved but still choppy when I send lots of mouse events. Some preliminary printouts reveal that the average FPS under lots of mouse events is about 25.8. Before this PR, I was seeing an average FPS of about 12.5 under these conditions.

MainWindow tests all pass with no crashes on my machine. Steve, did you install your workspace before running the test?

content.raw: by lots of mouse events, you mean moving + clicking?
content.html: by lots of mouse events, you mean moving + clicking?

content.raw: I think it's fine for this PR, and it's pretty cool that removing 6 lines gives a speedup of 10 FPS, but it looks like more optimizations will be needed to get closer to the max FPS for high-performance computers
content.html: I think it's fine for this PR, and it's pretty cool that removing 6 lines gives a speedup of 10 FPS, but it looks like more optimizations will be needed to get closer to the max FPS for high-performance computers
